column4: I hv karmic 9.10 installed suddenly today I am unable to see the control bar on the top but able to list all the menu options. If I just point to the right place I get the menu tell me how to fix this?
is your mouse able to move off of the screen? seemingly past the border of your monitor?
yes! I can do that
sounds like a resolution issue. what kind if video card do you have?
No video card on board intel 865 whatever chipset provides I am using it . It was alright till yesterday and suddenly today morning when I rebooted I am see thi
are you able to get to your System -> Preferences
yes
try to get to a Screen Resolution sorta preference and see if changing stuff in there helps
I just got the control bar. I just went into pref---> Appearance  and changed visual effects to extra and it started working. One more Q I need that rotate the desktop panel how do I do
the rotate cube?
: thats right
try holding ctrl and alt and then moving the mouse
you also need to set your virtual desktop count to 4
: got the desktop rotating
working?
Yeah! got it working thank you
good to hear :)
if you skip the part about the nvidia drivers, this might be of interest to you: http://www.howtoforge.com/enabling-compiz-fusion-on-an-ubuntu-9.10-desktop-nvidia-geforce-fx-5200
to hv the rotating cubing u need to change settings in System ---> pref --->CompizConfig settings
: select rotate cube option that is all I did
: also uncheck Desktop wall
